description: ADVERTISEMENT CONSENT FOR THE DISPLAY OF 2 x BANNER SIGNS ON LAMP-POSTS IN BEDDINGTON LANE
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed advertisement banners would be an inappropriate development on Metropolitan Open Land resulting in visual clutter which would not enhance the surrounding MOL and would set an unwelcome precedent contrary to policies 7.17 of the London Plan, policy CS 13 of the Core Planning Strategy and policies DM 05 & DM 01 of the Sites and Policies Plan

Reason : 2 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:

"	The applicant/agent was informed of any issues arising during consideration of the application and was advised to implement the signage approved in 2019

"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
site_name: Land North Of Beddington Lane Industrial Estate
